class_notes: This course will explore contemporaneity in literary studies, surveying a selection of recent novels, short stories, poetry, and works of speculative fiction. In particular, we will investigate how innovations in narrative form and style shape the contemporary representation of human and posthuman diversity across a spectrum of national, racial, gender, class, and sexual differences. Requirements include online journaling and critical analysis essays.
course_description: Selected works from various genres by writers from the 1950s to the present.
sections: Class Nbr: This section is full 2750, Section #: 1, Type: LEC, Campus: ATL, Meets: MW 10-11:15a, Instructor: W. Kalaidjian, Status: Closed
